methods.Synopsis: Search for entities—politicians, individuals or organizations— with the given name. Returns basic information about the contributions to and from each entity, as well as an ID that can be used in other API methods to retrieve more information.

parameters.Name: search
parameters.Description: The query string. Spaces should be URLEncoded or represented as +. There are no logic operators or grouping.

parameters.Name: type
parameters.Description: The entity type to search for

methods.Synopsis: Look up an entity ID from a different dataset. Currently we provide a mapping from the ID schemes used by Center for Responsive Politics (CRP) and the National Institute for Money in State Politics (NIMSP), as well as a few others. The result is a JSON object listing the TransparencyData IDs matching the given External ID.

parameters.Name: namespace
parameters.Description: The dataset and data type of the ID.

EnumeratedDescription.urn:crp:individual: A CRP ID for an individual contributor or lobbyist. Begins with U or C.
EnumeratedDescription.urn:crp:organization: A CRP ID for an organization. Begins with D.
EnumeratedDescription.urn:crp:recipient: A CRP ID for a politician. Begins with N.
EnumeratedDescription.urn:nimsp:organization: A NIMSP ID for an organization. Integer-valued.
EnumeratedDescription.urn:nimsp:recipient: A NIMSP ID for a politician. Integer-valued.
EnumeratedDescription.urn:sunlight:lobbyist_registration_track: URL of Sunlight's lobbyist registration tracker page

parameters.Name: id
parameters.Description: The ID of the entity in the given namespace. Used with the namespace parameter.

parameters.Name: bioguide_id
parameters.Description: The ID of a member of congress in the Congressional Bioguide. Mutually exclusive to the id/namespace parameters.

methods.Synopsis: Returns general information about a particular entity.

parameters.Name: entity_id
parameters.Description: The TransparencyData ID of the entity.

parameters.Name: cycle
parameters.Description: Limit contribution totals to the given election cycle.

methods.Synopsis: Returns the top n politicians, ranked by total dollars received.

parameters.Name: limit
parameters.Description: The number of results to return.

parameters.Name: cycle
parameters.Description: A YYYY-formatted year, 1990 up to the most recent election year. Pipe concatenation supported for OR searches, eg. 2008|2010.

methods.Synopsis: Returns the top contributing organizations, ranked by total dollars given. An organization's giving is broken down into money given directly (by the organization's PAC) versus money given by individuals employed by or associated with the organization.

parameters.Name: entity_id
parameters.Description: The TransparencyData ID of the entity to look up.

parameters.Name: cycle
parameters.Description: A YYYY-formatted year, 1990 up to the most recent election year. Pipe concatenation supported for OR searches, eg. 2008|2010.

parameters.Name: limit
parameters.Description: The number of results to return.

parameters.Name: limit
parameters.Description: The number of results to return.

methods.Synopsis: Returns a contribution count and total for a politician from unknown industries.

parameters.Description: The TransparencyData ID of the entity to look up.

parameters.Name: cycle
parameters.Description: A YYYY-formatted year, 1990 up to the most recent election year. Pipe concatenation supported for OR searches, eg. 2008|2010.

methods.Synopsis: Returns what each sector gave to the politician. Sectors are codified by letter: A: Agribusiness, B: Communications/Electronics, C: Construction, D: Defense, E: Energy/Natural Resources, F: Finance/Insurance/Real Estate, H: Health, K: Lawyers and Lobbyists, M: Transportation, N: Misc. Business, Q: Ideology/Single Issue, P: Labor, W: Other, Y: Unknown, Z: Administrative Use

parameters.Name: entity_id
parameters.Description: The TransparencyData ID of the entity to look up.

parameters.Name: cycle
parameters.Description: A YYYY-formatted year, 1990 up to the most recent election year. Pipe concatenation supported for OR searches, eg. 2008|2010.

parameters.Name: limit
parameters.Description: The number of results to return.

methods.Synopsis: Search for itemized campaign contributions at the federal (FEC) or state (NIMSP) level.

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: The format of the returned data.

parameters.Name: page
parameters.Description: The page number of results to return.

parameters.Name: per_page
parameters.Description: The number of results to return per page. Default is 1,000, max is 100,000.

parameters.Name: amount
parameters.Description: The amount of the contribution in US dollars. Prefix operators >| (greater than or equal to) and <| (less than or equal to) are supported.

parameters.Name: contributor_ft
parameters.Description: Full-text search on the name of the contributing individual, PAC, organization or employer.

parameters.Name: contributor_state
parameters.Description: The two-letter state abbreviation of the state from which the contribution was made, eg. DC.

parameters.Name: cycle
parameters.Description: A YYYY-formatted year, 1990 up to the most recent election year. Pipe concatenation supported for OR searches, eg. 2008|2010.

parameters.Name: date
parameters.Description: The date or date range of the contribution in ISO format. Start, end and range dates can be expressed like this: ><|2006-08-06|2006-09-12.

parameters.Name: for_against
parameters.Description: When organizations run ads against a candidate, they are counted as independent expenditures with the opposed candidate as the recipient. This parameter can be used to filter contributions meant for the candidate from those meant to be against the candidate.

parameters.Name: organization_ft
parameters.Description: Full-text search on the name of the contributing employer, organization or parent organization.

parameters.Name: recipient_ft
parameters.Description: Full-text search on the name of the PAC or candidate receiving the contribution.

parameters.Name: recipient_state
parameters.Description: The two-letter state abbreviation of the state in which the candidate receiving the contribution is running, eg. VA.

parameters.Name: seat
parameters.Description: The type of office being sought. In API calls, pipe characters can be used to include multiple options.

parameters.Name: transaction_namespace
parameters.Description: Filters results to federal- or state-only contributions.

methods.Synopsis: Search for itemized federal lobbying disclosures.

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: The format of the returned data. CSV is not supported with this endpoint.

parameters.Name: page
parameters.Description: The page number of results to return

parameters.Name: per_page
parameters.Description: The number of results to return per page. Default is 1,000, max is 100,000

parameters.Name: amount
parameters.Description: The amount spent on lobbying in US dollars. Prefix operators >| (greater than or equal to) and <| (less than or equal to) are supported.

parameters.Name: client_ft
parameters.Description: Full-text search on the name of the client for which the lobbyist is working.

parameters.Name: client_parent_ft
parameters.Description: Full-text search on the name of the parent organization of the client.

parameters.Name: filing_type
parameters.Description:
The type of filing as identified by CRP. CRP recommends you observe the following rules:

Do not total 'e' records unless they are larger than the associated 's' record.

Count 'c' records in both total and industry when filing_included_nsfs is 'n'. Don't count it in total or industry when filing_included_nsfs is 'y'.

Count 'b' records in both total and industry when filing_included_nsfs is 'n'. Exclude from total, and include in industry—but subtract it from the total of the parent—when filing_included_nsfs is 'y'.

EnumeratedDescription.m: non self filer subsidiary for a non self filter parent
EnumeratedDescription.x: self filer subsidiary for a non self filer parent
EnumeratedDescription.i: non self filer for a self filer parent that has same catorder as the parent
EnumeratedDescription.s: self filer subsidiary for a self filer parent
EnumeratedDescription.e: non self filer subsidiary for a self filer subsidiary
EnumeratedDescription.c: non self filer subsidiary for a self filer parent with same catorder
EnumeratedDescription.b: non self filer subsidiary for a self filer parent that has different catorder

parameters.Name: lobbyist_ft
parameters.Description: Full-text search on the name of the lobbyist involved in the lobbying activity.

parameters.Name: registrant_ft
parameters.Description: Full-text search on the name of the person or organization filing the lobbyist registration. This is typically the firm that employs the lobbyists. Use the registrant_is_firm field in the response object to filter on firms v. individuals

parameters.Name: transaction_id
parameters.Description: Report ID given by the Senate Office of Public Records

parameters.Name: transaction_type
parameters.Description: The type of filing as reported by the Senate Office of Public Records.

EnumeratedDescription.q1an: First Quarter Amendment (No Activity); First Quarter Termination Amendment (No Activity)
EnumeratedDescription.q3an: Third Quarter Amendment (No Activity);third Quarter Termination Amendment (No Activity)
EnumeratedDescription.q4an: Fourth Quarter Amendment (No Activity);fourth Quarter Termination Amendment (No Activity)

parameters.Name: year
parameters.Description: A YYYY-formatted year, 1999 up to the most recent election year. Pipe concatenation supported for OR searches, eg. 2008|2010.

methods.Synopsis: Search for itemized federal grants.

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: The format of the returned data. CSV is not supported with this endpoint.

parameters.Name: page
parameters.Description: The page number of results to return

parameters.Name: per_page
parameters.Description: The number of results to return per page. Default is 1,000, max is 100,000

parameters.Name: agency_ft
parameters.Description: Full-text search on the reported name of the federal agency awarding the grant.

parameters.Name: amount_total
parameters.Description: Total amount of the grant in US dollars. Prefix operators >| (greater than or equal to) and <| (less than or equal to) are supported.

parameters.Name: assistance_type
parameters.Description: A general code for the type of grant awarded.

EnumeratedDescription.06: Direct payment, as a subsidy or other non-reimbursable direct financial aid
EnumeratedDescription.11: Other reimbursable, contingent, intangible or indirect financial assistance

parameters.Name: fiscal_year
parameters.Description: The YYYY-formated year in which the grant was awarded, 2000 up to the most recent election year. Pipe concatenation supported for OR searches, eg. 2008|2010.

parameters.Name: recipient_ft
parameters.Description: Full-text search on the reported name of the grant recipient.

parameters.Name: recipient_state
parameters.Description: Two-letter abbreviation of the state in which the grant was awarded, eg. MD.

parameters.Name: recipient_type
parameters.Description: The type of entity that received the grant

methods.Synopsis: Search itemized federal contracts awarded.

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: The format of the returned data. CSV is not supported with this endpoint.

parameters.Name: page
parameters.Description: The page number of results to return

parameters.Name: per_page
parameters.Description: The number of results to return per page. Default is 1,000, max is 100,000

parameters.Name: agency_id
parameters.Description: The FIPS code for the agency, eg. 51013.

parameters.Name: contracting_agency_id
parameters.Description: The FIPS code for the contracting agency, eg. 51013.

parameters.Name: current_amount
parameters.Description: Current value of the contract in US dollars. Prefix operators >| (greater than or equal to) and <| (less than or equal to) are supported.

parameters.Name: fiscal_year
parameters.Description: The YYYY-formatted year in which the grant was awarded, 2006 up to the most recent election year. Pipe concatenation supported for OR searches, eg. 2008|2010.

parameters.Name: maximum_amount
parameters.Description: Maximum possible value of the contract in US dollars. Prefix operators >| (greater than or equal to) and <| (less than or equal to) are supported.

parameters.Name: place_district
parameters.Description: The congressional district in which the contract action will be performed.

parameters.Name: place_state
parameters.Description: The FIPS code for the state in which the contract action will be performed, eg. 50

parameters.Name: requesting_agency_id
parameters.Description: The FIPS code for the requesting agency, eg. 50103

parameters.Name: obligated_amount
parameters.Description: The amount obligated or de-obligated by the transaction in US dollars. Prefix operators >| (greater than or equal to) and <| (less than or equal to) are supported.

parameters.Name: vendor_city
parameters.Description: Full-text search on the name of the primary city in which the contractor does business.

parameters.Name: vendor_district
parameters.Description: The primary congressional district in which the contractor does business.

parameters.Name: vendor_duns
parameters.Description: The Dun & Bradstreet number assigned to the contractor.

parameters.Name: vendor_name
parameters.Description: Full-text search on the name of the contractor.

parameters.Name: vendor_parent_duns
parameters.Description: The Dun & Bradstreet number assigned to the corporate parent of the contractor.

parameters.Name: vendor_state
parameters.Description: The primary state in which the contractor does business, eg. NY.

parameters.Name: vendor_zipcode
parameters.Description: The primary zipcode in which the contractor does business, eg. 20036.
